result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary P Tipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $ 100 + costs = $579 plus 33 in subpoena fees,  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 2/26/16 and on the 26th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

The Court determines that DNA is already on file

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary P Tipton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 4:46pm [mo]
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $ 100 + costs = $579 plus 33 in subpoena fees,  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 2/26/16 and on the 26th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

The Court determines that DNA is already on file
recess: 5:13pm
Examining psychologist's report - reviewed by Court

Case called at 1:30pm [mo]
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.


On the State's Motion to Impeach with Priors:
--No objection from Mr. Tipton
--For purposes of Trial Mr. Tipton has 1 prior conviction

On the State's Motion to Admit Statements:
--The Court grants the State's Motion to Admit Statements

Atty. De La Rosa notifies the Court that the NGI report has not been received by the evaluator as of yet; the Court directs parties to schedule an additional Motion hearing date as desired.
recess: 1:38pm
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant

Case called at 9:15am [mo]
Defendant Gary P Tipton in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

Plea of "not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $750  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--No Contact with Mary Reed

The Clerk prepares The Order for Examination under 971.16, with the Court's advisement
The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial; distributes its Scheduling Order. 
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Tipton. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess:9:35am 


NEXT:    (1) FSSC on 1/25/16 at 3:00pm    (2)  Jury Trial on 1/28/15 at 8:30am
